reviews.review_msg: His lectures are good but the problem is that he teaches you questions that are way easier than what he expects you to solve. Intuition for solving problems is also something he didnt really give much of. Brutal final exam avg was around 40%

Hardest class I've taken so far. His slides are too cluttered, and homework was tough but doable, exams were brutal (midterm avg: 50%, final avg: 40%). He pulls questions from MIT-level sources. Also, he can be rude if you give an “interesting” answer. Even scoring above avg, I got a B-. Not a GPA booster! Curve was just 1.02x.

Sharan explains topics very well, and he tries to make the lectures engaging. He also replies really quickly to questions on piazza. But the exams were tough, especially the finals. Maybe don't make 30% of the final about a topic that we've learned 3 days ago on the last day of class. Overall, good prof but hard class

He cares for the students and listens to our feedback. He posts answers to hws and tuts. All material in lectures relate to what we need to know and he goes through many examples. This class was hw heavy but the hw was not bad. He knows what he's doing and also enjoys it. Too bad the class was at 830 and I found the material difficult.

He's literally so smart. His lectures are basically repeating the textbook but he makes it very understandable. Assignments were difficult but graded easily. Go to office hours as much as possible for assignments since they give big hints towards the answers. Test questions came from the textbook and very difficult. Do the textbook questions.

Sharan Vaswani is pretty ehhh. Assignments make up a lot of the mark and are really difficult especially if you dont have friends to chat with or use ChatGPT to get an idea of wtf to do. The lectures are meh, explanation of concepts is ok but could be much better imo. Overall kinda meh course with this prof

Chill prof who responds to messages very quickly. Slides are very neat and he shares annotated versions of them. Allows a cheat sheet for the final, which was really nice, as the exams were pretty difficult. The assignments, worth 45% total, were pretty lenient in marking, resulting in extremely averages (which were brought down by exams marks).

The lectures are pretty good and course policy in general is quite lenient (lecture/tutorial participation not mandatory, weighted passing average on exams not needed to pass the course, detailed solutions to assignments/tutorials posted consistently), but the sheer difficulty for a lower division course makes me unwilling to recommend to take

I think he's great, I like him a lot. Knowledgable and clear lecturer. The only downside is that his confidence in us is a little bit high, definitely not an easy course by any stretch of imagination and the midterm was also hard given the time constraint. Hope he makes the final a little more reasonable. But overall, not bad! Thanks prof!

Great professor, his lectures are pretty good as he provide the theory and then does some application with them, which is appreciated versus just spitting out theory like other profs. Assignments and tutorials are hard, but set you up well for tests, which are VERY HARD. But otherwise, he is a good lecturer and I'd recommend taking him for 210.
Great Prof! One of the best ones at sfu.His lectures are thorough. He focus on explaining concepts rather than providing formulas to solve problems. Exams and assignments are tough.

His lectures are some of the best, the concepts were explained clearly. But, the tests are just too difficult. Expect similar question difficulty to the assignments, i.e. don't expect questions where you only have to apply one theorem, or even know which to apply. Overall you learn a lot, because you are forced to understand everything well.

Genuinely nice guy. Very accessible through office hours and piazza. Lectures are very thorough but do little to build intuition so can be hard to follow. You'll have to do lots of self-study to fully understand concepts. Homework and exams are very difficult.

Took his class in his first teaching term and I though he did pretty good. He had a piazza and office hours where he would always answer question quickly and his website included all the lectures filled in and posted along with free textbook pdfs and the chapters + the chapters we should review. Tough tests, but good class overall, learned a lot.
Goated prof!

He does his best to explain the course material, even though it's a difficult subject. The midterm was really tough, so you absolutely need to have a strong analytical grasp of the examples in the slides to do well. Luckily the homework was worth a big chunk of our final grade and was marked fairly, which was a huge relief.

Very accommodating professor as everyone else says. Responds to questions on piazza and email quite fast. There were four assignments worth 45% which were quite time consuming and difficult. His midterm had an avg of 43% but it was scaled slightly at the end of the course. Personally, I found his lectures very hard boring and hard to bear.

Best prof for this hard class. He actually cared about us, listened to our feedback and implemented it. Like recording lectures after we asked, making the final and marking easier after a hard midterm. Curved the end grade to make up for the hard midterm. Tries his best to make the content easier to understand. Answers you on Piazza even at 1:40 am

Professor Mohammad's lectures are detailed. Given his lectures are borrowed from another professor's (whose lecture material is very difficult), Mohammad does a great job breaking down the difficulty of this course by a couple notches! If Mohammad has the time to make his own lectures, no doubt this course will be a lot easier and less stressful

Pretty good prof. He was great at explaining the slides he was using despite adopting them from another professor. Very helpful in office hours. The midterm was awful difficulty wise but he revised the difficulty and made the final quite easy in comparison, and ended up curving slightly at the end. The course is hard though, good luck D:

The class itself is not easy whtsoever. So dont think tht a good prof = easy class. The class & content is alot of work. But the prof is super nice & caring. Responds to everyone really well. Takes feedback and improves. Is clear throughout his lectures. Consistently asks if anyone has any questions. Out of everyone who teaches 210, he is the best
Who needs enemies when you have professors like Bradley Bart?

Final worth 60% and you can't pass if you don't score C- on it❤️ but final was made for you to fail❤️ 0 turnaround time between last class and exam day❤️yet final is demonically difficult anyway, Brad doesn't care❤️ majority of class will fail❤️ he will blame you❤️ See how the hearts don't make it better Bart?❤️ (Not written by ChatGPT❤️)
Brad I was wrongly imprisoned 30 years ago for a crime YOU committed. I will have my revenge.

Course content isn't easy but if you work hard you will score well on the assignments and midterm. But don't worry! That will all go to waste with the final that will be 10x harder than anything you have seen all semester. ! Don't bother taking this class if you want to pass it, Brad won't let you. He enjoys seeing his students fail! I love SFU!

Another example of SFU profs sabotaging students. Students work hard all semester long throughout assignments and the midterm maintaining a strong class average and then get hit with an unbelievably difficult final worth 60%. Then Brad says he's disappointed with the outcome. You are disappointed buddy? Imagine how tired we are. Shame on you.

overall pretty good at explaining concepts and kept the lectures engaging, he recorded lecture but idk if he will in the future bc he got really annoyed that no one was showing up to class. midterm and assignments were fair but the final was really hard and worth 60%

60% of your grade is the brutal final exam. Everything prior was fair, and the lectures were nice. Plus, they were recorded but you need to watch them within a certain period, or they disappear. I just took screenshots of all the lectures and crammed for like three days before the final and got a C+, so it wasn't too bad I'd say.
The final fried 60% of the class

Organized and good lectures but terrible exams and grading. 60% final with no practice exams. Need a 50% or higher on the final to pass and 65% of the class failed it. Was also much harder than the midterm. He could've prepared students better but he just really doesn't care for student to pass. Instead he blames the students for the low average.

brad is a fine prof, but cmpt210 is way too difficult.
lectures are good and are recorded.
marking was clear and fair. good communication.
no practice material other than a 10 question assignment every two weeks.
too many textbooks, with a lot of content overlap. some sections used all 5 at the same time.
final was worth 60% of total grade.

Lectures & teaching was fine. Assignments were quite difficult but still doable. Exams was quite difficult especially the final. Policy was pass final = pass the course. I don't approve of it, especially with the final being crazy hard. Wouldn't suggest taking. I scored 90+ on all assignments, couldn't get that to prep me for exams.

Brad if you're reading this, just know there are no bad students and only bad teachers. The fact that the class average is so low is a testament to your teaching skills. Yes, it's "disappointing" but the disappointment here is you. Next time instead of a 60% final, make it an 80% one so you can ramble more about how "disappointed" you are
Made the assignments and midterm very straight forward, but when it came to the final(worth 60% of your grade), he made the questions 10x harder.

Brad was pretty good considering the stigma around him. He has good lectures, fast marking, a fair midterm, good assignments, and records his lectures (but deletes them after 2 weeks). The only downside was that I found the final to be a bit unfair, as questions were in forms we had not seen before. Other than that, he also makes jokes. xd

The midterm was very much easier than the final. (Midterm average was 60%, final evrage was 46%). Do not use GPT to do the homeworks or you will suffer in the final. He's a good prof, but a tough grader. He uploads the lecture online for a limited time, although he did threaten to remove them if the class attendance was low, so make sure to show up
60% final, but if you're cracked then the GOAT Brad Bart will give you a good grade. Don't listen to the people who failed, they're just mad cause bad.

If you want to feel like you know what your doing in a class take it with Brad Bart. You'll feel like your Thanos right until the final exam which was the most evil, diabolical, heinous crime I have ever seen a prof get away with. There is no amount of studying that could save you so just keep this class on the backburner if its with Bartholomew.

Pros:
-fairly decent lectures
-midterm was fair
-assignments were decent and helpful
Cons:
-the final is worth 60 percent and is nowhere near the difficulty of the midterm, example questions, or assignments. 
-lecture recordings disappear
-no practice tests
If not for the final he would be higher rated.

The midterm was fair. Assignments weren't too bad either. But the final was outrageous. The final being worth 60% of your final grade and being so hard i mean mid way through i thought “it's so over”. He was good right until when he tortured us with his final. I mean Brad why man?. It was 14 questions and he also had negative marking for Q1.

there is no prof i hate more than brad. doesnt know how to teach, doesnt allow taking photos of the slides, doesnt provide notes, no lecture recordings, no practice problems or paper and makes the exams insanely hard, and then wonders why nobody attends his class.
Brutal final worth 60% and no pizza party I am disappointed Brad
60% final and it was VERY hard, he had no practice questions or papers, lecture recordings were only available till a week, do not recommend taking him.
Final is 60% of the grade, but his assignments and exams are very fair. Overall one of the best professors at SFU, you will not regret taking a course with Brad Bart.

Final worth 60% of your grade 
Terrible at simplifying and explaining concepts. There is no practice except for the few assignments he gives. He always sounds tired and uninterested in what he's teaching, constantly sighing and not very enthusiastic.
Chill guy, good at bridge. Tough course but he gives you the resources to succeed.

Worst prof . Exams are intentionally made hard and they are unrelated to class material and assignment questions  . If you are average at maths and stats then you will most probably fail this class , wait one of my friend is really good at maths he also failed this class ( by good i mean A in all maths and stat ). So AVOID HIM

Not sure if it's the Course or the prof but it was a mess. Except the assignments, there was nothing to practise. No past papers, 6-7 textbooks being referenced and the exams were really hard. The syllabus topics were weird and a lot of the content taught in lectures was never referenced again. The course was curved well so can't complain much.

such a really bad course and prof. For real. Not interesting at alllllll. He is trying to be funny but what is the point when we literally do not understand anything. He just comes to the class and starts proofing and solving questions in his own. Bunch of difficult proofs and not easy to understand concepts and he even made them tougher.
He's good
